page.title: 17 James Duncan Centre
page.content: Built in 1975 because of an increase in the number of homeless men in the city. It is run by Glasgow District Council and caters for 254 men who must be over the age of 18. They can stay as long as they wish and many have been there since it opened. All the men in the unit at present are unemployed. The money for their rent comes from the Social Security. The cost is Â£38.50 per week or Â£5.50 per day. The accommodation is a single room per person. The facilities are two recreation rooms, a laundry, bathrooms, showers and a canteen for buying meals. Men come and go as they wish and are given as normal a living situation as possible. The staff is made up of two supervisors, four porters, cleaners and canteen workers.
